intro: Myrobalanus oblonga, commonly known as the longleaf myrobalan, is a small deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its elongated, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by edible, round berries. Its bark is thick and fissured, often exuding a resinous sap. It is commonly found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
